name: Pan-Seared Chicken with Thyme
description: A simple pan sauce can transform an everyday boneless, skinless chicken breast into a quick and delicious meal. For a finishing touch, garnish with a sprig of thyme.
recipeIngredient: 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut in half lengthwise to make thin cutlets
salt and ground black pepper to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Season both sides of chicken with salt, pepper, and dried thyme. Place flour in a shallow dish and dredge both sides of chicken pieces in flour.

Heat oil in pan over medium-high heat. When oil starts to shimmer, add the chicken. (If the chicken browns too quickly, reduce heat.) Cook, turning as needed, until chicken is browned on both sides, is no longer pink in the center, and the juices run clear, 4 or 5 minutes total on each side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Transfer chicken to a plate and tent with foil.

In the same pan, reduce heat to low and add thyme sprigs and cook until aromatic, 1 or 2 minutes. Increase heat to high; pour in Swanson® Chicken Stock and wine. Stir up browned bits to deglaze the pan. Add the chicken bouillon granules and mix well. Reduce heat to medium and cook until sauce reduces and is slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove pan from heat.
Remove and discard the thyme sprigs. Add to the pan any accumulated juices from the tented chicken plate. Finish the sauce by whisking in the cold butter. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Spoon sauce over chicken before serving.

review.reviewBody: I will make it again, even considering using the,sauce,as a marinade for a future dish.

I was looking for a quick easy recipe for chicken breast and this did not disappoint!  I used 2  1/2 lb chicke teders and doubled the other ingredients.  I only had 1/4 cup of white cooking wine,  so in order to get 1/2 cup, I added 1/4 cup red cooking wine.  It tasted very good, my son who usually only likes meat with BBQ sauce took a second helping.  I made red smashed potatoes as a side, and my husband used the extra sauce as gravy for the potatoes.  Will definitely make again.

Followed the recipe as directed. Turned out very well. Will definitely make again. (My husband liked it the way it turned out, but I felt it needed a little more pizzazz, so I took half of a small lemon and squeezed some fresh lemon juice right over it - perfect!)
RAVE reviews from the family. Simply delish!

Yum! I thought this was delicious! I made the sauce ahead of time and used half of it to marinate the chicken and so the flavors could marry together. I also added about a half tablespoon flour to the cooked sauce to thicken it a bit - it just seemed too liquidy. I'm not a fan of dredging many things in flour and while it had a good taste and crispness I think next time I'll make it without that part. But all in all it was delicious served with a chicken flavored rice pilaf corn and sugar snap peas. Will make again!
I made this recipe as-is and I feel like it lacked flavor. I think adding fresh lemon juice would make it have more flavor.

WOW!! Followed directions perfectly nothing was changed and this is a HIT! Just to note: The sauce never thickened for me but it was still soooo delicious didn't matter! Some reviews said to add lemon juice but I don't see why. Not needed.

This recipe is excellent! I made it as is and the results were a juicy and tender chicken that was centerpiece on the plate and palate! I served with the Really Simple Rice recipe from this site and it was beyond outstanding. I will definitely make it again good bye dry and chewy chicken breasts!

This was really good! I was looking for something different to do with chicken cutlets & this recipe fit the bill. I didn't have chicken stock & used chicken broth instead. Pretty much followed the rest of the recipe. Served with Stove Top Stuffing and Broccoli.  One thing, I will omit salt next time as it was def not needed, probably due to broth and stuffing. Thanks for the recipe. Will surely make it again!
